So, if I ever do meet Caesar, though I have no doubt that he will be lenient to Quintus and that he has already made that plain, Ι shall behave as I always have behaved. But, as I see, what I ought to be most anxious about is Africa, which you say is daily growing stronger, though only to the extent of raising hopes of a compromise rather than a victory. If it could only be true! But I read the signs quite differently, and Ι think you agree with me, and only say the contrary to hearten me, not to deceive me, especially as Spain too has now joined Africa.1
